children.name: army b1
children.definition: army/ˈɑːʳmi/  a large organized group of people trained to fight on land in a war: quân đội (trên đất liền)
examples: the army
units of the nigerian army were quickly sent to the border.
in the army
my sons are both in the army.
raise an armycollect and organize an army to fight a battle
tổ chức một đạo quân, chiêu quân
▪ in 1066 william the conqueror raised an army and invaded england.

children.name: navy b2
children.definition: navy/ˈneɪvi/  the part of a country’s military forces that is trained for fighting a war at sea: hải quân
examples: the navy
it was an important battle for the navy.
in the navy
my father was in the navy during the war

children.name: air force b1
children.definition: air force/ˈeəʳfɔːʳs/  the part of a country’s military forces that is trained for fighting a war in the air: không quân
examples: the french have a very powerful airforce
the airforce
the airforce played a huge part in the kosovo conflict.
in the airforce
my brother and sister are both in the airforce.

children.name: the military c1
children.definition: the military the army, navy, and air force of a country: lực lượng vũ trang, quân đội
examples: the military may be sent in to deal with the riots.
a company that supplies electronic equipment to the military.

children.name: the armed forces x
children.definition: the armed forces the army, navy, and airforce of a country: lực lượng quân đội, vũ trang
examples: a new government minister is now responsible for the armed forces.
measures will be taken to help modernize the country’s armed forces.

children.name: forces b2
children.definition: forces/ˈfɔːʳsɪz, ˈfɔːʳsəz/  groups of soldiers from a country’s army, navy, and airforce: lực lượng
examples: the town was captured by italian forces under the command of general ciano.
the united states placed its forces in the region on alert.
ground forces were wiped out by the air attack.

children.name: the services b2
children.definition: the services/ the service  the army, navy, and airforce - use this especially when talking about sb having a job in the army etc: quân chủng
examples: in the service(s)
camp lejune was the first place i was stationed when i was in the service.
go into the servicesnhập ngũ
the family has a tradition of going into the services.

children.name: sb who is in the army, navy etc
serviceman x
children.definition: serviceman/ servicewoman a man or woman who is in an army, navy etc : quân nhân
examples: the ceremony was held to honour the tens of thousands of servicemen and servicewomen who lost their lives in the war
four australian servicemen were reported missing after the ambush.
a tribute to the bravery of our servicemen and -women

children.name: soldier b1
children.definition: soldier/ˈsəʊldʒəʳ/  a member of an army, especially someone whois not an officer : lính, quân lính
examples: moore has been a soldier for most of his adult life.
there were several soldiers guarding the main gate.

children.name: troops c2
children.definition: troops/truːps/  soldiers - use this especially to talk about soldiers taking part in a military attack : quân lính
examples: thousands of french troops died in the attack.
the president is sending three hundred troops to the area.

children.name: sailor b1
children.definition: sailor/ˈseɪləʳ/  a member of the navy: lính thủy
examples: janet married a sailor in the french navy.
two thousand british sailors lost their lives when the ship went down.

children.name: airman x
children.definition: lính không quânairman/ˈeəʳmən/  a member of the airforce: binh sĩ không quân
examples: three airmen were killed during the battle.

children.name: officer b2
children.definition: officer a high-ranking member of the army, navy etc, who is in charge of a group of soldiers, sailors etc: sĩ quan
examples: he’s an officer in the us marines.
commanding officer(the officer in charge) : sĩ quan chỉ huy
colonel gary g. mahle is the commanding officer here.

children.name: veteran c2
children.definition: veteran (usinformalvet) someone who has been in the armed forces during a war:cựu chiến binh
examples: avietnamveteran
the surviving veteransofworld war ii

children.name: commander c2
children.definition: commander an officer who is in charge of a military operation, or an officer of a particular rank in the british royal navy : chỉ huy

children.name: used by or connected with the army, navy etc
military b2
children.definition: military/ˈmɪlɪtəri, ˈmɪlətəriǁ-teri/  used by or connected with the army, navy, or airforce, especially the army: quân đội
examples: the president visited a military cemetery at bitburg.
china reportedly planned to sell military equipment to saudi arabia
peres said the military campaign would last as long as it took to secure the country’s northern border.

children.name: army b1
children.definition: army/ˈɑːʳmi/  connected with or used by the army: quân sự, quân đội
examples: there’s an american army base nearby.
an army jeep was parked outside their house.
army officers have overthrown the government in a well planned coup d'état.

children.name: naval c2
children.definition: naval/ˈneɪvəl/  connected with or used by the navy: (thuộc) hải quân
examples: his orders were to protect the port from naval attack.
a huge chinese naval base
stedman spent nine months recovering in a naval hospital.

children.name: air a2
children.definition: air/eəʳ/  connected with or used by the airforce: thuộc không quân
examples: the island’s defences have been badly damaged by recent air attacks.
ground forces will be backed up by nato air power.

children.name: camp b2
children.definition: camp a place where soldiers stay when they are training or fighting a war : doanh trại
examples: an army camp

children.name: base x
children.definition: base/beɪs/ a place where there are military buildings and weapons and where members of the armed forces live: căn cứ
examples: an old naval/military base

children.name: watchtower x
children.definition: watchtower chòi canh; tháp canh
examples: a tower built especially around the edges of prisons and army camps, the top of which provides a good position from which to see anyone who is coming close

children.name: ghq x
children.definition: ghq đại bản doanh; tổng hành dinh; sở chỉ huy
examples: abbreviation for general headquarters: the main centre from which a military operation is controlled.

children.name: the marines x
children.definition: the marines/ the marine corps/ðə məˈriːnz, ðə məˈriːn kɔːʳ/  a specially trained part of the us armed forces: lính thủy đánh bộ
examples: a special force of 500 us marines has been sent to the area.
i have a 25-year-old brother who’s in the marine corps.

children.name: division b2
children.definition: division a separate part of an army or large organization :sư đoàn
examples: the parachute division

children.name: infantry x
children.definition: infantry
examples: the part of an army that fights on foot :bộ binh
the infantry was/were sent into battle.
it's alight/heavyinfantry unit.

children.name: artillery x
children.definition: artillery very large guns that are moved on wheels or metal tracks, or the part of the army which uses these :pháo binh
examples: naval gunfire and ground-based artillery are generally less accurate than many aircraft-borne weapons.

children.name: cavalry x
children.definition: cavalry the group of soldiers in an army who fight intanks, or (especially in the past) on horses :kỵ binh

children.name: squad x
children.definition: squad
examples: in the army, a squad is a small group of soldiers, especially one brought together fordrill(= marching, etc.) :tổ, đội

children.name: be stationed x
children.definition: station
examples: be stationed[] if a member of an army, navy, or air force is stationed somewhere, they are sent to that place for a period of military duty: đóng quân
i hear your son's in the army - where's he stationed?
be stationed in/at/there etc
my uncle was stationed in burma during the war.
at the weekend, all the local bars were full of soldiers stationed at fort bragg.
the regiment was stationed in singapore for several years.
armed guards were stationed around the airport.
